activities: Personal Information Received from Switzerland:  Eli Lilly and Company and its US affiliates may receive a number of different types of data from Switzerland, including data about:  employees, potential employees, and their family members; patients and clinical and medical research subjects; clinical and medical investigators and staff conducting clinical and medical research; adverse event reporters and subjects; consumers; investors and shareholders; medical and healthcare professionals; animal healthcare professionals; pet owners; farmers; customers; vendors, suppliers, contractors, and business partners; and government officials.  These data are transferred to the US for use as part of the company's business operations in the areas of:  research and development of its products; compliance with the company's regulatory obligations; market research for its products and services; marketing and sales of its products; its activities as an employer to support and fulfill its obligations to its employees; finance and tax activities; its undertakings with vendors, suppliers and contractors of goods and services; and other legal and business activities.
personaldata: Human resources, clinical research, pharmacovigilance, customer, business partner, and vendor data. Includes manually and electronically processed data.
recoursemech: American Arbitration Association (AAA) for non-human resources data;  EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for human resources data only.
